title: The Bachelorette stylist opens up about dressing the contestants
text:
From leopard print to striking red suits, this season of The Bachelorette has definitely challenged traditional dress codes.

And on Friday, Channel Ten's official stylist Kim Hurwitz opened up about dressing the contestants in loud and flamboyant ensembles.

Speaking to Now To Love, she said: 'These men have outgoing and large personalities and they want to show that through their suiting as well as their everyday looks.'

'I love to experiment on the show': The Bachelorette's official stylist, Kim Hurwitz, has opened up about dressing the contestants in loud and flamboyant ensembles

'Suit brands such as M J Bale, Peter Jackson and Politix provide so much variety in colour and print, I love to experiment with it on the show,' she added.

Kim explained that the contestants also have an input in their final looks each week and have 'close to a 1000 suits' to choose from.

She said: 'Most of the men would come up to the wardrobe room each week and tell me exactly what they felt like wearing that week.'

'They want to show their personalities through their suiting': Kim said the contestants wear the ensembles that best suit their character (pictured Ciarran Stott)

Variety: Kim also explained that the contestants have an input in their final look each week and have 'close to a 1000 suits' to choose from (pictured Timm Hanly)

This season, Ciarran Stott has definitely dressed to impress in an array of colourful suits.

During the introductions, the 25-year-old turned heads in a red tuxedo and left Angie Kent blushing with his cheeky sense of humour.

The long-haired Englishman has continued to make a statement in a range of unique tuxedos including a leopard number, a floral piece and numerous striking colours.

Striking! Ciarran Stott (pictured) has definitely dressed to impress in an array of colourful suits on this season of The Bachelorette

Meanwhile, Ciarran is also one of the frontrunners to win Angie's heart on this season of The Bachelorette.

But it could be all over for the fan favourite who storms out of the cocktail party in an explosive trailer for Wednesday night's episode.

After confronting Jamie Doran in a heated conversation, Ciarran angrily walks off set and tells producers to 'get me out of here'.

The Bachelorette continues Wednesday at 7.30pm on Channel Ten.
